Answer.156433: i have a few gripes about the industry as a whole that just really bother me and turn me off from horse racing . even if not every single racehorse trainer is outright abusive to their animals , the extreme physical toll that running so fast takes on the horses bodies results in poor health and injury that can even result in the death of the horse . horses were never meant to run that fast or for so long . it s people who have bred them to be that way and it s people who are stressing horse s bodies to their breaking points . the idea in general seems almost cruel to me . i also have a distaste for the general poor treatment of the vast majority of animals running races who aren t top winners , for how many horses a year die at racetracks as a result of being pushed too hard or from being mishandled , and the fact that horses are raced while they re very young years old before their bones are developed and fused enough to carry a rider or properly absorb the shocks of galloping at top speed over long distance . i hate the way that so many horses essentially get discarded when they don t win like pieces of garbage left to rot out in a back field somewhere or sent to slaughter to make dog food . the culture of horse racing which treats the animals like pawns in a game designed to make money with no regard for the welfare of the animals also really bothers me and makes me feel uncomfortable . not to mention the shortcuts , cruelties , and seedy medical practices like pin firing that are also happening behind the scenes just so people can feel like they re getting ahead or to force the horse to ignore pain in order to make them more money . not sure if it s the case anymore , but i know jockeys historically haven t been treated particularly well either and have starved themselves and lived on low wages to make weight and get by .
